info.title: lemlist API
info.description:
Welcome to the lemlist Developer Documentation.

lemlist is very customizable and open. You'll find on this page all the API and integration you can do with lemlist.

# Rate Limit

lemlist's API rate limits requests in order to prevent abuse and overload of our services.  
Rate limits are applied on all routes and per API key performing the request.  
The rate limits are **20** requests per **2** seconds.  
The response provides any information you may need about it:

| Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Retry-After | The number of seconds in which you can retry |
| X-RateLimit-Limit | The maximum requests in that time |
| X-RateLimit-Remaining | The number of remaining requests you can make |
| X-RateLimit-Reset | The date when the rate limit will reset |

_Example of values for the rate limit headers_

``` json
{
    "Retry-After": 2,
    "X-RateLimit-Limit": 20,
    "X-RateLimit-Remaining": 7,
    "X-RateLimit-Reset" : "Tue Feb 16 2021 09:02:42 GMT+0100 (Central European Standard Time)"
}

 ```

# Definitions

## Team

A team is the entity of lemlist that can handle users and billing.

## Credits

Credits are the coins a team uses to enrich emails, LinkedIn URLs, etc. via the enrich route. Each enrichment feature needs a certain amount of credits to run.

## User

You use a user account to connect to lemlist and send messages via the connected emails or LinkedIn account.

## Campaign

A campaign is the entity to automate outreach. A campaign has multiple sequences composed of steps.

## Lead

A lead is a person that you try to contact via a campaign.

## Activity

An activity is the history of all the steps.

## Unsubscribe

An unsubscribe occurs when a person decides they don't want to receive emails from you anymore.

# Authentication

All API routes use the dedicated subdomain `api.lemlist.com`.

lemlist uses API keys to allow access to the API. You can get your lemlist API key at our [integration page](https://app.lemlist.com/settings/integrations).

You need to add the `Authorization` header using the `Basic` authentication type. `login:password` **where the login is always empty and the password is the API key**.

⚠️ **Don't forget to add the semicolon (**`:`**) before your API key in curl command.**

> To authorize, use this code: 
  

``` shell
curl https://api.lemlist.com/api/team \
  --user ":YourApiKey"

 ```

**Make sure to replace** **`YourApiKey`** **with your API key.**

# Give feedback

If you want to report a bug, ask for data, or share with us a use case, please fill this [form](https://lemlist.typeform.com/to/mfVlkyGf). It will help us centralize your needs!

Team.description: The organization account that manages users and billing.

createdBy.description: User ID who created the team

createdAt.description: Date and time when the team was created

beta.description: Beta features enabled for the team

slackWebhook.description: Slack webhooks configured for the team

agency.description: Agency identifier if team is part of an agency

Credits.description: Credits are the coins a team uses to enrich emails, LinkedIn URLs, etc. Each enrichment feature needs a certain amount of credits to run.

User.description: A team member account with connected email and/or LinkedIn sending capabilities.

role.description: User role in the team (admin, member, etc.)

inviteLimit.description: Daily limit for LinkedIn connection invites

visitLimit.description: Daily limit for LinkedIn profile visits

mailboxes.description: Email mailboxes connected to this user

Campaign.description: An automated outreach workflow containing sequences of steps.

teamId.description: ID of the team that owns this campaign

errors.description: List of error messages if campaign has errors

Lead.description: A prospect added to a campaign for outreach.

campaignId.description: Campaign ID the lead belongs to

campaignName.description: Campaign name the lead belongs to

Activity.description: A recorded action or event in a campaign sequence (email sent, opened, clicked, etc.).

Unsubscribe.description: A record of someone opting out of receiving emails.

campaignId.description: Campaign ID from which the person unsubscribed

campaignName.description: Campaign name from which the person unsubscribed

Enrich.description: Contact information discovered through data enrichment (emails, phone numbers, LinkedIn URLs).

Task.description: A manual action assigned to a user to complete.

Contact.description: A contact record in your CRM.

teamId.description: Team identifier the contact belongs to

fields.description: Custom fields associated with the contact

campaigns.description: List of campaigns the contact is associated with

ownerId.description: ID of the user who owns this contact

createdBy.description: ID of the user who created the contact

Company.description: An organization record in your CRM.

name.description: Company name (may also be present under fields.name)

fields.description: Flexible key/value fields of the company (e.g., name, picture, industry, location, size, foundedOn)

createdBy.description: User ID who created the company

ownerId.description: User ID of the owner of the company

DatabaseCompany.description: A company record from lemlist's People database.

CompanyNote.description: A text note attached to a company record to store information.

teamId.description: Team ID that owns the company

userId.description: ID of the user who created the note

sendUserId.description: ID of the sending user if applicable

Sequence.description: An ordered series of steps within a campaign.

Step.description: A single action in a sequence (email, LinkedIn message, delay, task, etc.).

Schedule.description: Sending time windows defining when campaigns can send messages (days and hours).

public.description: Whether the schedule is available as a template for other users

teamId.description: Unique identifier of the team that owns this schedule

createdBy.description: Unique identifier of the user who created this schedule

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the schedule was created

deletedAt.description: Timestamp when the schedule was deleted (only present if deleted)

deletedBy.description: Unique identifier of the user who deleted this schedule (only present if deleted)

Webhook.description: Webhooks send real-time HTTP notifications upon campaign events (opens, clicks, replies, etc.).

campaignId.description: The ID of the campaign the webhook is associated with (if any)

zapId.description: Zapier integration ID (if the destination is a Zapier webhook)

Report.description: Aggregated campaign performance statistics (sent, opened, clicked, replied, etc.).

Mailbox.description: An email account connected to a user for sending campaigns.

totalRecords.description: Total number of schedules across all pages

nextPage.description: Next page number (null if on last page)

CrmFilter.description: A filter used in the CRM to segment leads or companies.

InboxConversation.description: A message thread between a user and a contact in the inbox.

InboxConversationPagination.description: Paginated response containing multiple inbox conversations.

InboxMessage.description: A single message within an inbox conversation.

InboxMessagePagination.description: Paginated response containing multiple inbox messages.

DatabaseFilter.description: Saved search criteria for querying the People database.

PeopleSchema.description: A person record from lemlist's People database.

lead_id.description: Numeric identifier for the person in the People database

CompaniesSchema.description: A company record from lemlist's Companies database.

company_type.description: Company type (e.g., Privately Held, Public Company)

techno_used_array.description: Array of technologies used by the company

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset from the start. For pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of campaigns to retrieve. Default: 100. Maximum: 100.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Set to 'v2' to use the latest version

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The field by which to sort. Currently, only 'createdAt' is supported.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The sort direction. Use 'desc' for descending order; any other value (or omission) will sort in ascending order.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The campaign status. Can be: running, draft, archived, ended, paused, errors. Note: a campaign can be in multiple statuses at one time (e.g., a paused campaign with errors).

example.name: Product Launch Campaign
errors: Your campaign does not have sender.

Your campaign have an invalid sender mailbox

total.description: Total number of items to process

url.description: Download URL for the CSV file (only present when status is done)

put.description: Set an email address for a given export. When the export is done, an email with the download URL will be sent to the address provided.

url.description: Download URL for the CSV file

email.description: Email address that will receive the notification

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the campaign

get.description: Export leads from a campaign with filtering options. Returns leads in CSV or JSON format based on their state (e.g., contacted, interested, replied, etc.).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter to export only the specified lead's last states. Use 'all' to export all states. Can be a comma-separated list of states. **Global states**: imported, scanned, skipped, reviewed, contacted, hooked, attracted, warmed, interested, notInterested, emailsBounced, emailsUnsubscribed, failed, meetingBooked, paused. **Detailed states**: emailsSent, emailsOpened, emailsClicked, emailsReplied, emailsInterested, emailsNotInterested, emailsFailed, opportunitiesDone, aircallDone, aircallInterested, aircallNotInterested, apiDone, apiInterested, apiNotInterested, linkedinVisitDone, linkedinVisitFailed, linkedinInviteDone, linkedinInviteAccepted, linkedinInviteFailed, linkedinSent, linkedinOpened, linkedinReplied, linkedinInterested, linkedinNotInterested, linkedinSendFailed, manualInterested, manualNotInterested

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format: 'json' or 'csv'. Default is CSV.

401.description: Unauthorized

get.description: Retrieve reports for one or multiple campaigns. Returns aggregated statistics and export status for the specified campaigns.

parameters.name: campaignIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of campaign IDs to retrieve reports for

creator.description: Creator user ID and email in format 'userId|email'

createdBy.description: Name of the user who created the campaign

senderNames.description: Comma-separated list of sender email addresses

sendersUsers.description: Comma-separated list of sender names and emails

emailsClicked.description: Number of emails with links clicked

emailsInterested.description: Number of interested responses via email

notInterested.description: Total number of not interested leads

401.description: Unauthorized

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the campaign

schema.description: Object where each key is a sequence ID and each value is a sequence object

_id.description: The unique identifier of the sequence

steps.description: Array of steps in the sequence

_id.description: The unique identifier of the step

delay.description: The delay in days before executing this step

emailTemplateId.description: The unique identifier of the email template used for this step

type.description: The type of step (e.g., email, linkedinSend, linkedinInvite, conditional)

index.description: The position of the step in the sequence

sequenceId.description: The unique identifier of the parent sequence

sequenceStep.description: The step number in the sequence

message.description: The message content for the step (plain text for LinkedIn, HTML for email)

subject.description: The email subject line (only for email steps)

level.description: The nesting level of the sequence (0 for main sequence, 1+ for nested conditional sequences)

parentId.description: The unique identifier of the parent sequence (only for conditional sequences)

conditionalStepIndex.description: The index of the conditional step that triggers this sequence (only for conditional sequences)

steps.message:
Hey {{firstName}}, 

we're launching an event, a place where people can regularly meet, network, and learn from each other. We would love it if you could join us for a drink & chat next week. What do you say? 😊

steps.subject: {{firstName}}, do we count on you for the event?
steps.message:
Hey {{firstName}},

Do you have any plans for Thursday, 7pm?

What about spending the evening with cool people by our office?

We're launching an event, a place where people can regularly meet, network, and build connections that help them grow further 😊

It would be really nice if we could count on you for the event- here's your invite 🔥


Can you make it?

Sarah,

Head of Marketing

steps.subject: {{firstName}}, do we count on you for the event?
steps.message:
So, should I add you to the list of attendees?

We'll meet around 7pm, have a drink and exchange with entrepreneurs, marketers, and salespeople.

Here's the link if you want to join!

We would love to have you with us for this event!

Sarah

Head of Marketing

type.description: The type of step to create

index.description: The position within the sequence to insert the new step (≥ -1). If omitted or greater than the number of steps, the new step is added to the end

delay.description: Delay in days before executing this step. Defaults to 0 for the first step and 1 for subsequent steps

subject.description: Email subject line (required for email steps)

message.description: Content of the email or message (used for email, linkedinInvite, linkedinSend, manual, phone, whatsappMessage steps)

title.description: Title or label for manual steps

url.description: URL of the API endpoint to call (required for api steps). Must start with http:// or https://

campaignId.description: Target campaign ID for sendToAnotherCampaign steps. The campaign must exist and not be archived

value.subject: {{firstName}}, quick question about {{companyName}}
value.message:
Hi {{firstName}},

I noticed {{companyName}} is working on improving customer engagement. Would you be interested in discussing how we can help?

Best regards,
{{senderName}}
Hi {{firstName}}, I'd love to connect and learn more about your work at {{companyName}}!
Hey {{firstName}}, thanks for connecting! I wanted to reach out about...

value.title: Call prospect
value.message: Discuss their pain points and schedule a demo
Follow up on the email sent yesterday
Hi {{firstName}}, following up on our conversation...

Call to discuss the proposal sent via email

post.description: Search the lemlist People database using structured filters and optional free-text, with pagination support. Use GET /database/filters to discover available filterIds and their expected value formats.

requestBody.description: Search criteria. Provide one or more filters and optionally control pagination with page/size and a free-text search.

size.description: Number of results per page (max 100). Default: 25

search.description: Free-text query across common people fields (e.g., name, title, company, location)

results.summary: Passionate about helping sales teams book more meetings @lemlist
results.headline: Helping RevOps scale outbound @lemlist

post.description: Search the lemlist Companies database using structured filters with pagination support. Returns comprehensive company data including technologies used, location, employee count, and other business intelligence.

filters.description: Array of filter objects to narrow down search results. Each filter has a filterId and inclusion/exclusion criteria.

filterId.description: The identifier of the filter to apply (e.g., 'currentCompanyTechnologies', 'companySize', 'industry')

in.description: Array of values to include in the filter

out.description: Array of values to exclude from the filter

size.description: Number of results per page (default: 100, max: 500)

total.description: Total number of companies matching the search criteria

took.description: Time taken for the search in milliseconds

results.company_description:
CodeTentacles, established on Aug-2015 with the idea "Make Your Imagination Come True". Which means anyone who came up with their idea, we will give a closely realistic solutions to them. 
CodeTentacles Technologies is a new Generation Software Company, with young people with creative mind and immersive energy. We are a team of dedicated and highly skilled software professionals focused on providing world class IT solutions. We offer a variety of services in the area of:
Website Designing & Development, Web Maintenance, E-Business Solutions, Android & iOS app, Blockchain Development, Software Development, Hosting Services.

get.description: Retrieve tasks with optional filtering and pagination. Tasks marked as `done` are excluded from results.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for paginated results (0-indexed).

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
JSON array of filter objects. Each filter has a `filterId` and specific parameters.

**Available Filters:**

- `fullName`: Filter by contact's full name.
  - Parameters: `value` (string) or `regex` (string)
  - Example: `{"filterId":"fullName","value":"John Doe"}`

- `email`: Filter by contact's email address.
  - Parameters: `value` (string) or `regex` (string)
  - Example: `{"filterId":"email","value":"john@example.com"}`

- `phone`: Filter by contact's phone number.
  - Parameters: `value` (string) or `regex` (string)
  - Example: `{"filterId":"phone","value":"+1234567890"}`

- `linkedin`: Filter by LinkedIn profile URL.
  - Parameters: `value` (string) or `regex` (string)
  - Example: `{"filterId":"linkedin","value":"linkedin.com/in/johndoe"}`

- `campaignId`: Filter by campaign IDs (inclusion/exclusion).
  - Parameters: `in` (array of strings) and/or `out` (array of strings)
  - Example: `{"filterId":"campaignId","in":["cam_123"],"out":["cam_456"]}`

- `campaignState`: Filter by campaign states.
  - Parameters: `in` (array of strings) and/or `out` (array of strings)
  - Allowed values: `draft`, `running`, `ended`, `paused`, `errors`, `archived`
  - Example: `{"filterId":"campaignState","in":["running","paused"]}`

- `type`: Filter by task type.
  - Parameters: `in` (array of strings) and/or `out` (array of strings)
  - Allowed values: `manual`, `phone`, `linkedinInvite`, `linkedinSend`, `linkedinVoiceNote`, `emailsReplied`, `opportunityReplied`, `linkedinReplied`, `opportunityClicked`, `email`, `whatsappMessage`
  - Example: `{"filterId":"type","in":["phone","email"]}`

- `assignedTo`: Filter by assigned user IDs.
  - Parameters: `in` (array of strings) and/or `out` (array of strings)
  - Example: `{"filterId":"assignedTo","in":["usr_123","usr_456"]}`

- `dueDate`: Filter by due date range.
  - Parameters: `from` (string, YYYY-MM-DD) and/or `to` (string, YYYY-MM-DD)
  - Example: `{"filterId":"dueDate","from":"2025-01-01","to":"2025-12-31"}`

Multiple filters can be combined in an array.

message.description: Optional message/description of the task. Defaults to an empty string if omitted.

data.message:
Hello lemlist Team! 😎

I joined lemlist last Monday, and I am humbly offering you the chance to meet me (and probably my cat, Megatron 😽🤖) through a 15-minute call at your convenience! You can book it [here](https://app.lemcal.com/@camille-ingouf/reunion-de-15-minute?leadId=lea_jcw2hneu7qs7iYKBr).

See you soon!

Camille INGOUF
data.subject: Meet me !

data.message:
Haha Welcome Christophe, j'adore cette campagne !

A très vite,
Victoire

On Tue, Dec 3, 2024 at 10:52 AM Christophe OPOIX <christophe.o@lemtest.com> wrote:

Hey Victoire ,


I hope this email finds you well!


Have you ever heard about Christophe Opoix?

🇫🇷 He was a member of the French Parliament during the French Revolution,
🏘️ He has a street named after him
📙 He authored the famous "Beurre frais épuré, et conservant longtemps ses bonnes qualités, sans devenir rance".


Unfortunately, this brilliant man died ages ago...


But wait, there's another Christophe Opoix you might be interested in meeting—one who is very much alive and well! Yes, that's me. I've just joined Lemlist, and I'm looking forward to meeting everyone for a quick chat.


☑️ Book an appointment on 📅 my lemcal !


Feel free to reach out and get to know me better. I'm excited to be part of the team and eager to contribute to our collective success.

Looking forward to seeing you all soon!

Best regards, as your contemporary, Christophe Opoix
data.subject: Re: Have you heard about Christophe Opoix ?

get.description: Retrieve detailed statistics for a specific campaign, with filtering options by date, user, A/B testing, and communication channels.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: Unique campaign ID

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: sendUser
parameters.description: Filter stats by send user. Format: `sendUserId|sendUserEmail`. The sendUserId should begin with 'usr_' and the sendUserEmail should be a valid sender email. If the param is specified, both sendUserId and sendUserEmail are mandatory.

parameters.name: ABSelected
parameters.description: A/B version filter

parameters.name: channels
parameters.description: JSON array of channels to include. Possible values: 'email', 'linkedin', 'others'

nbLeads.description: Total number of leads in the campaign

nbLeadsLaunched.description: Number of leads launched in the campaign

nbLeadsReached.description: Number of leads that were successfully reached

nbLeadsOpened.description: Number of leads that opened messages

nbLeadsInteracted.description: Number of leads that interacted with messages (clicked, replied)

nbLeadsInterested.description: Number of leads marked as interested

nbLeadsNotInterested.description: Number of leads marked as not interested

nbLeadsInterrupted.description: Number of leads with interrupted sequences

messagesNotSent.description: Number of messages that failed to send

replied.description: Number of messages that received replies

steps.description: Detailed metrics for each step in the campaign

clicked.description: Number of clicks from a message from this step

unsubscribed.description: Number of unsubscribes from this step

missingDates.value: Bad params: startDate and endDate are required

invalidChannels.value: Bad params: channels must be a valid array

invalidChannelValues.value: Bad params: channels must be empty or contain "others", "email" or "linkedin"

invalidAB.value: Bad params: ABSelected must be A or B

invalidSendUserFormat.value: Bad param format: sendUser must be formatted as follow: <sendUserId>|<sendUserEmail>

invalidSendUser.value: Bad params: the send user email is not related to the send user id

post.description: Send a batch of enrichment requests for multiple entities. Maximum 500 enrichment requests per call.

parameters.name: webhookUrl
parameters.description: Webhook URL for enrichment events

input.description: Input data for enrichment. Required fields depend on enrichmentRequests.

linkedinUrl.description: The LinkedIn URL of the person

companyName.description: The name of the company associated with the person

companyDomain.description: The domain of the company associated with the person. Recommended for better find rate

firstName.description: The first name of the person

lastName.description: The last name of the person

enrichmentRequests.description: Array of enrichment types to perform. Must contain at least one of: find_email, find_phone, verify, linkedin_enrichment

metadata.description: Custom data to be returned in the response and webhook. Can be a string or an object

200.description: Success - Returns enrichment IDs and metadata for each request

metadata.description: The metadata provided in the request
The metadata provided in the request

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input format or parameters

wrong_input_format.description: The input of each enrichment must be an object containing at least one of the required fields

wrong_metadata_format.description: The metadata field must be a string or an object

no_workflow_requested.description: The enrichment request must contain at least one of the authorized workflows (find_email, find_phone, verify, linkedin_enrichment)

wrong_enrichment_request_format.description: The enrichment request must be an array

unauthorized_workflow_requested.description: The enrichmentRequests contained invalid request types

too_many_enrichments_requested.description: There is a limit of 500 enrichments per request

no_enrichments_requested.description: The body must contain at least one enrichment request

wrong_body_format.description: The body must be a valid array
